acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was suggested from 96-hour LC50>10mg/L of the fish (Oryzias Latipest) (MOE Eco-Toxicity Tests of Chemicals, 2002) that relevant toxicity is not indicated in the water solubility (15mg/L(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) of this substance, it was classified into Not classified.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,960mg/kg, representing the lower of the two testing data, 1,960mg/kg and 18,800mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 97-23 (1998)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible based on expert judgment, given the absence of existing classification.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was not reported within the aqueous solubility concentrations and there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 74.7% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since the bio-accumulation (log Kow=2 (PHYSPROP Database (2005))) was low, it was classified into Not classified.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as "flammable" according to ICSC (2004).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in NTP DB (Access on Feb., 2006), SIDS (2004).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 496degC (ICSC, 2004)

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of decreased weight gain and reduced viability in pups at dosing levels toxic to parental animals or in the absence of data on parental toxicity, described in SIDS (2004), MOE Risk Assessment vol.3 (2004) and CERI Hazard Data 97-23 (1998).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 97-23 (1998), ACGIH (7th, 2001) and SIDS (2004)): "non-irritating" or "slightly irritating." The substance is thus considered a "mild irritant."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on skin irritation tests in rabbits and human volunteers (CERI Hazard Data 97-23 (1998), ACGIH (7th, 2001) and SIDS (2004)): "non-irritating" or "slightly irritating." The substance is thus considered to possess "mild skin irritation" (though it is unclear whether the results are those of 4-hour application).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests: "Negative." Also based on the description of the effects on human health (CERI Hazard Data 97-23 (1998)): "No sensitizing effects observed in humans."

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (urinary bladder)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "degeneration of the bronchial mucosal epithelium," "bladder calculus" (CERI Hazard Data 97-23 (1998)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 (respiratory organs) and Category 2 (bladder).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "mild irritation of the respiratory organs" (HSDB (2005)).
